column4: i have a box that is restarting almost precisely every hour... anyone know what could cause this?
is it power management related?
don't know... it simply reboots... no warnings on the logs
is it idle?
not really.. but not on high load... it's a quad.. using like 2-5%
no I mean is it headless, ie, you are not actually actively on it
physically
yes its headless... take a look that the rebooot times.... http://pastebin.com/m241d35
I would investigate power related things, see if its set to power down or whatever
erm, suspend I mean
i changed it's name from venus to sol but it is the same box
yeah look at what I mentioned
and look in crontabs
i'll go there tomorrow.. can't check it from here
adn what not
only hourly job on crontab was ntpdate to my local ntp server (i commented it out... )
Hmm ok.
what about the rest of cron.
nothing hourly..
Weird.
stopped cron... let's see what happens next hour
do you know a way to turn of all power management features without rebooting?
